page.title: 12SOCIAL LIFE CATTERICK AREA
page.content: There are no clubs as such in this area but many residents are members of clubs in the proximity of their homes. For the very young there is a play group, for older children there is Brownies, Guides, Rangers, Cubs, Scouts, Venture Scouts, a Youth Club, St Johns Ambulance Cadets and a Cricket Club, the Angling Association, the Karate Club and the local theatre Company. For the older residents there is the Women's Institute, The Fifties Club, and the Social Club. There are several clubs associated with the churches - The Sunday School, The Mother's Union and the Handbell Ringers. Most of these clubs are classed as charitable organizations and depend on support from the public.
